title: Fix cross-package @cygnus-wealth dependency resolution breaking E2E tests
description:
attached_molecule: hq-wisp-wi2md
attached_at: 2026-02-16T15:48:39Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. ROOT CAUSE: package-lock.json has @cygnus-wealth/asset-valuator as a local link (resolved: ../asset-valuator, link: true) instead of npm registry. The broken symlink at node_modules/@cygnus-wealth/asset-valuator points to a nonexistent path. All other @cygnus-wealth packages resolve from npm registry correctly. FIX: 1) Remove broken symlink at node_modules/@cygnus-wealth/asset-valuator. 2) Fix package-lock.json entry to resolve from npm registry like the others (latest published is 0.3.0). 3) Update package.json to ^0.3.0. 4) Run npm install. 5) Verify npm run build succeeds. 6) Verify npm run test:e2e passes (Playwright, 62 tests).
dispatched_by: mayor

E2E tests fail in 3 rigs due to broken @cygnus-wealth/* package resolution.

EvmIntegration: Cannot find @cygnus-wealth/data-models at all. Vitest fails to load E2E suite.

SolIntegration: data-models installed but dist broken â€” dist/enums/AssetType module not found. SolanaIntegration.e2e.test.ts fails to load.

CygnusWealthApp: Vite dev server cannot resolve @cygnus-wealth/asset-valuator in src/hooks/useAccountSync.ts. 54/64 Playwright E2E tests timeout because page never loads.

Root cause: @cygnus-wealth packages (data-models, asset-valuator) are not installed, have stale dist builds, or broken symlinks in consuming rigs.

Fix required:
1. Rebuild data-models â€” ensure dist exports match package.json exports map (especially enums/AssetType)
2. Republish or relink data-models in EvmIntegration and SolIntegration node_modules
3. Install asset-valuator in CygnusWealthApp
4. npm install in all 3 consuming rigs
5. Verify: npm run test:e2e passes in EvmIntegration, SolIntegration, and CygnusWealthApp

Affected rigs: EvmIntegration, SolIntegration, CygnusWealthApp, DataModels (source), AssetValuator (missing from CWA)
notes: ROOT CAUSE for CygnusWealthApp: package-lock.json has asset-valuator as a local link (resolved: ../asset-valuator, link: true) instead of npm registry. Symlink at node_modules/@cygnus-wealth/asset-valuator points to ../../../asset-valuator which resolves to /home/jacob/gt/asset-valuator â€” path does not exist (rig is /home/jacob/gt/AssetValuator). All other @cygnus-wealth packages resolve from registry correctly. Fix: remove broken symlink, update package-lock.json to use registry (latest 0.3.0), run npm install, verify all 62 e2e tests pass.

title: Polecat sessions timeout during E2E verification pipeline
description:
attached_molecule: hq-wisp-tnam1
attached_at: 2026-02-16T21:22:18Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. This is a docs-only architecture research task. Write a recommendation document to a new file. See bead description for full requirements.
dispatched_by: mayor

Polecats consistently exhaust their session/context budget before completing the commit+submit cycle when E2E tests are involved. The verification pipeline (npm install ~2min + Playwright browser install ~3min + build + unit tests + 64 E2E tests across chromium+firefox ~5min) takes 9-11 minutes total. Polecats also need time to investigate, implement fixes, and commit. By the time E2E finishes, the session is dead.

Evidence from CygnusWealthApp:
- chrome polecat (hq-3asww): Needed 0 code changes. Deps already correct. E2E was running at 2m48s into 5m timeout when session died.
- rust polecat (hq-04rc8): Changed 2 lines in package.json. Build passed, unit tests running when session died.
- Both polecats did real work but never reached commit+gt done.

This affects any rig with E2E tests (CygnusWealthApp has Playwright, others have Vitest E2E). The problem will get worse as test suites grow.

Need an architectural solution. Some options to evaluate:
1. Split verification: commit first, verify in a separate step (refinery or CI)
2. Pre-install Playwright browsers in worktree templates
3. Increase polecat session/context budget for E2E-heavy rigs
4. Run E2E as a post-merge CI gate instead of pre-commit polecat responsibility
5. Polecat checkpointing â€” save progress and resume in a new session
6. Parallel test execution to reduce wall clock time

The solution must work within GT's autonomous agent model where polecats are ephemeral and unattended.

title: No USD values displayed on portfolio balances
description:
attached_molecule: hq-wisp-y1jzy
attached_at: 2026-02-16T23:12:11Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Investigate directly. The app is not showing USD values on portfolio balances. Check how AssetValuator pricing is integrated, whether price providers are returning data, and whether pricing data is being wired into balance display components. Fix the root cause and ensure USD values appear.
dispatched_by: mayor

User reports the app is not showing any USD values on token/asset balances. The portfolio view displays balances but without fiat (USD) conversion values.

Symptom: Balances appear without USD pricing/valuation.

Likely involves:
- How CygnusWealthApp calls AssetValuator for pricing
- Whether AssetValuator's price providers are returning data
- Whether the app is wiring pricing data into the balance display components

Investigate root cause. If the issue is in @cygnus-wealth/asset-valuator package, escalate with specifics.

title: Phase 1A: Create @cygnus-wealth/rpc-infrastructure package with RPC config types
description:
attached_molecule: hq-wisp-4rapc
attached_at: 2026-02-20T23:30:57Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. P0 â€” Create the @cygnus-wealth/rpc-infrastructure package. This is a NEW package that houses RPC infrastructure config types that were incorrectly placed in data-models. Setup: TypeScript, Vitest, npm @cygnus-wealth scope, ESM-only. Create all RPC config types: RpcProviderRole, RpcProviderType (managed|decentralized|public|community|user), RpcEndpointConfig, ChainRpcConfig, RpcProviderConfig, CircuitBreakerConfig, RetryConfig, HealthCheckConfig, UserRpcEndpoint, UserRpcConfig, PrivacyConfig. Depend on @cygnus-wealth/data-models for ChainId only. Reference EnterpriseArch mayor/rig/en-tfkn-decentralized-rpc-provider-strategy.md and en-1mg1-rpc-types-placement-analysis.md. TDD â€” write tests first.
dispatched_by: mayor

NEW PACKAGE: @cygnus-wealth/rpc-infrastructure

Per en-1mg1 architectural analysis, RPC infrastructure types do NOT belong in data-models (shared kernel). Create a new dedicated package.

MOVE from data-models to this new package:
- RpcProviderRole, RpcProviderType (with 'decentralized' and 'user' values)
- RpcEndpointConfig, ChainRpcConfig, RpcProviderConfig
- CircuitBreakerConfig, RetryConfig, HealthCheckConfig
- UserRpcEndpoint, UserRpcConfig, PrivacyConfig

This package will also eventually house runtime classes (CircuitBreaker, FallbackChain, RateLimiter, HealthMonitor) in later phases.

Package depends on data-models for ChainId/ChainIdentity only.

Setup: TypeScript, Vitest, npm publish config matching other @cygnus-wealth packages. Follow TDD.

Reference: EnterpriseArch mayor/rig/en-1mg1-rpc-types-placement-analysis.md section 5 (Option A) and section 6.

title: Emit ESM from evm-integration dist (fix CJS require)
description:
attached_molecule: hq-wisp-t59uu
attached_at: 2026-02-16T01:56:55Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. Change tsconfig compilerOptions: set module to NodeNext, moduleResolution to NodeNext. The package.json already has type:module. Rebuild dist â€” verify dist files use import not require. npm run build && npm test must pass.
dispatched_by: mayor

evm-integration tsconfig emits CJS (require() calls in dist). Downstream consumers like CygnusWealthApp use Vite which cannot resolve data-models via require() since data-models exports only has import condition. Fix: change tsconfig compilerOptions module to NodeNext (or ESNext) and moduleResolution to NodeNext so dist emits ESM import statements. package.json already has type:module. npm run build && npm test must pass. Verify dist/*.js files use import not require.

title: Fix missing USD values on portfolio balances
description:
attached_molecule: hq-wisp-e9q7p
attached_at: 2026-02-16T23:22:05Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. COMMIT EARLY before tests. The exact root cause and fixes are in the bead description. Three bugs in useAccountSync and useProgressiveAssetLoading. Make the edits, COMMIT IMMEDIATELY, then run tests. Do not wait for tests before committing. Previous polecat confirmed all 197 tests pass.
dispatched_by: mayor

EXACT ROOT CAUSE IDENTIFIED (from previous polecat investigation):

THREE bugs in CygnusWealthApp causing zero USD values:

1. EVM NATIVE TOKEN PRICE HARDCODED (useAccountSync hook)
   - The EVM path does NOT call fetchPrice(chainConfig.symbol) like the Solana and SUI paths do
   - Fix: Replace hardcoded value with real fetchPrice() call, same pattern as Solana/SUI paths

2. ERC20 TOKEN PRICES ALWAYS ZERO (useAccountSync hook, ~lines 163-164)
   - ERC20 tokens always get priceUsd: 0, valueUsd: 0 with no price fetch
   - Fix: Add fetchPrice() call for each ERC20 token symbol, compute valueUsd from balance * price

3. useProgressiveAssetLoading ENTIRELY DISABLED (~line 287-289)
   - Has a bare 'return;' statement with comment '// TEMPORARILY DISABLED to debug performance issue'
   - Even when enabled, it used simulated random prices instead of real data
   - Fix: Remove the return statement, replace simulated prices with real AssetValuator calls via dynamic import, add symbol deduplication to avoid redundant API calls

INSTRUCTIONS: These are the EXACT fixes needed. Implement them, commit IMMEDIATELY after editing (before running full test suite), then run tests. Previous polecat confirmed all 197 tests pass with these fixes. COMMIT EARLY â€” do not wait for test results to commit.

title: E2E testing strategy: define policy per bounded context
description:
attached_molecule: hq-wisp-0rd2x
attached_at: 2026-02-14T20:31:09Z
dispatched_by: mayor

Define the enterprise-wide E2E testing strategy for Cygnus Wealth. For each bounded context (DataModels, EvmIntegration, WalletIntegrationSystem, AssetValuator, SolIntegration, RobinhoodIntegration, PortfolioAggregation, CygnusWealthApp), determine:

1. Whether E2E tests are appropriate for that context
2. What E2E scenarios should be covered (if any)
3. What test infrastructure is needed (Playwright, mock providers, test fixtures, chain forks, etc.)
4. How E2E tests interact across bounded context boundaries

Context: Unit tests are now green across most rigs. E2E tests exist in some rigs (CygnusWealthApp has Playwright, EvmIntegration had a failing test:e2e script) but there is no coherent enterprise-wide E2E policy.

IMPORTANT: Document all architectural decisions and standards in the EnterpriseArch repo. This becomes the canonical reference that domain/rig architects follow.

After the enterprise policy is defined, it must trickle down â€” each rig architect should receive guidance and document their rig-specific E2E strategy in their own repo.
close_reason: Work merged to main â€” e2e-testing-strategy.md committed

title: Fix data-models exports map: add CJS require condition
description:
attached_molecule: hq-wisp-887sc
attached_at: 2026-02-16T17:51:18Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. The data-models package.json exports field only has 'import' (ESM) conditions. Downstream packages like evm-integration use require() (CJS), and Vite dep pre-bundling in CygnusWealthApp fails with: 'No known conditions for . specifier in @cygnus-wealth/data-models package'. FIX: Add 'require' conditions to EVERY export path in package.json exports map. Each entry currently has {types, import} â€” add a 'require' field pointing to the CJS equivalent. If CJS dist files don't exist, update the tsconfig/build to emit both ESM and CJS. Ensure the package builds cleanly and all tests pass. The fix must be published as a patch version.
dispatched_by: mayor

data-models package.json exports only specify 'import' (ESM) conditions but downstream packages like evm-integration use require() (CJS). Vite dep pre-bundling in CygnusWealthApp fails with: 'No known conditions for . specifier in @cygnus-wealth/data-models package'. The exports map needs 'require' conditions alongside the existing 'import' conditions for all export paths (., ./enums/AssetType, ./enums/Chain, etc). Published version 1.1.1 has this bug. Fix the exports map in package.json to include require conditions pointing to CJS dist files, rebuild, and publish a patch.

title: Fix evm-integration to emit ESM instead of CJS
description:
attached_molecule: hq-wisp-izd1y
attached_at: 2026-02-16T00:35:11Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. The dist output is CJS (uses require()). Change tsconfig to emit ESM so dist uses import statements. The package.json already has type:module. Likely need to change tsconfig compilerOptions module to ESNext or NodeNext and moduleResolution to match. npm run build && npm test must pass. Verify dist files use import not require.
dispatched_by: mayor

evm-integration dist files use CJS (require() calls). When consumed by Vite in CygnusWealthApp, esbuild dep pre-bundler hits require('@cygnus-wealth/data-models') but data-models exports map only has 'import' condition â€” no 'require' or 'default'. Vite crashes, all 64 Playwright E2E tests fail. Fix: change evm-integration tsconfig to emit ESM output (e.g. module: ESNext or NodeNext) so dist uses import instead of require. Verify: npm run build succeeds, npm test passes, and the built dist files use import statements not require().
